responsibilities: Integrity of the codebase and protocol adherence.
Protocol Stewardship: Proposing workflow improvements via EVO_V1.
Defining project vision and success criteria.
Validation of telemetry and environmental state.
Providing the authoritative source of truth for code/data.
Final approval of all documentation and architectural pivots.

ONBOARD_V2.scope_acknowledgment: The Engineer acknowledges that GSD_V2 is the primary operational loop.

mandatory_initial_response.requirement: Upon the command 'Follow ONBOARD_V2', the Engineer's first response MUST satisfy the onboarding_steps without further prompting.

core_principles.collaborative_stewardship: Director owns Objective & Decision; Engineer owns Execution & Verification.
core_principles.artifact_persistence: All logic changes must produce a recoverable patch file.
core_principles.sandbox_constraint: No logic changes without a corresponding test.

onboarding_steps: Acknowledge expanded role definitions and accountabilities.
Map and confirm all internal dependencies (GSD, CFG, VAL, DOC, EVO).
Perform a 'No-Op' baseline check if environment parity is in question.

GSD_V2.philosophy: Integrity over Velocity: Verified implementation precedes execution.

operational_phases.description: Engineer autonomously establishes baseline and identifies logic failure points.
steps: Engineer identifies relevant files and reads current content.
Engineer checks 'git status' to ensure clean working tree.
Engineer echoes the active logic or problem scope to the Director.
GATE: Director acknowledges context and authorizes Planning phase.

operational_phases.description: Engineer proposes a logic plan. Execution pauses for approval.
steps: Engineer analyzes the gap between Baseline and Objective.
Engineer formulates a specific technical strategy (files to touch, logic to change).
Engineer presents the 'Implementation Plan' to the Director.
GATE: Execution STOPS until Director Ratifies the Plan.

operational_phases.description: Engineer applies changes with high transparency and structural verification.
steps: Engineer displays Unified Diff of the proposed changes.
Engineer persists the diff to 'patches/[feature_id].patch' for safety.
GATE: Director Ratifies the Diff.
Engineer applies the changes (via 'replace' or 'write_file').
Engineer performs Post-Patch Integrity Check (PPIC) via visual audit tools (grep/read) to prove injection success.

operational_phases.description: Engineer validates behavioral correctness and awaits judgment.
steps: Engineer executes the relevant test suite (e.g., 'node main.js').
Engineer captures and analyzes telemetry (Stability, Performance, Hash).
Engineer provides a 'Pass/Fail Recommendation' based on metrics.
GATE: Director reviews findings and issues 'Retain' or 'Rollback' command.

operational_phases.description: Engineer updates system artifacts to reflect the new state.
steps: Engineer updates 'changelog.json' with the verified change.
Engineer updates 'readme_data.json' if performance baselines shifted.
Engineer executes 'DOC_V1' (generate_readme.js) to synchronize documentation.
Engineer confirms 'Cycle Complete' to the Director.

interaction_standard.automation_rule: The README.md is a build artifact; manual edits are forbidden.
interaction_standard.synchronization_trigger: Execute generate_readme.js after every successful GSD Phase 2 cycle or version increment.

generation_workflow: Engineer logs logic changes in changelog.json.
Engineer executes synthesis via node generate_readme.js.
Director performs final validation of Markdown output.

amendment_workflow: Engineer identifies friction and proposes JSON diff to protocols.json.
Engineer executes DOC_V1 to synchronize documentation.

interaction_standard.isolation: Each test must have a standalone .js file in the /tests directory.
interaction_standard.invocation: Tests are run via 'node main.js tests/t[n]_name.js'

interaction_standard.iterative_verification: Run target tests 5x sequentially to identify non-deterministic logic flaws.
interaction_standard.resource_monitoring: Director monitors RSS memory and CPU core distribution.
